tweets.text: @TalesofaWildGuy @NE_WestMids @The_RRC @Trent_R_Trust @EnvAgencyMids That‚Äôs great!

More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts: https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ

 #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/3YfkRdZjwe

We've been busy over the last month tackling Japanese knotweed. This invasive non-native plant outcompetes our native plant species.  We are working hard so our river is knotweed free!! #INNS #INNSOUT #riverholme @EnvAgency @YISF__INNS https://t.co/RjI4CJvKqg

Today two @EnvAgency field operations officers from our Cramlington depot cleared parts of the River Don at West Boldon in preparation for the forecast bad weather by #StormAlex and to their surprise they fished out 18 shopping trolleys which were returned to @asda #Boldon https://t.co/WxRtfZv2QY

tweets.text:
Good segment on @BBCRadio4 this morning on why 100% of England's river are polluted. TNX @VGravey

@EnvAgency say there has been some improvement due to farmers using less fertiliser.

The reality. Any improvement was pre 2008.

The current chair joined the board in 2009. Hmm. ü§î https://t.co/G55KaL8jiP

Anyone noticed that no one from the @EnvAgency is prepare to face the media and be held accountable for the Agency's dismal performance.

Curious. The board are all public appointees who's Code of Conduct warns "Holders of public office are accountable to the public........." https://t.co/C4d5ucEvZL

It appears I've been quoted in a letter to @thetimes today written by the chair of the @EnvAgency.

It begins "Sir, The Environment Agency is neither a discredited nor failed organisation".

PS. Quote was taken from @thetimes editorial on Saturday. https://t.co/kIJubfJCty

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes That'll be the letter which opens with part of my quote from @thetimes' Leading Article on Saturday which was titled

"Environment Agency's failure to clean up England's waterways is lamentable."

Thank you for reminding everybody I said it.

https://t.co/wEhpmv4d7G

tweets.text:
So what has @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, the water industry and cheating got to do with a Sex Pistols gig on the 14th Jan 1978 in San Francisco?

You're going to have to tune in tomorrow night to find out.

You know it makes sense.

https://t.co/JPSyolWS2R

By the way. Where is the @EnvAgency's annual accounts for 2019 - 20, were they not supposed to be published back in July?

https://t.co/4spPocBe8A

A compelling and devastating round-up of the calamity facing England's rivers and the "Hotbed of mediocrity", that is the @EnvAgency.

Great stuff by @RachSalv https://t.co/d01T1Ts2Ft

Good old @EnvAgency does it again. Missed its own performance target by nearly 25%.

Aim for 2019 - 20, "Enhance", 2,300 kilometres of rivers, lakes and coastal waters.

Result? Fail!

Question. What exactly do you mean by "enhanced"? How is that defined, who makes that decision? https://t.co/9x3KDtkqDj

Another great article in #BraughingLife on @FriendsRib @AquiferChalk and the ongoing fight for our Chalkstreams - @AffinityWater @thameswater @EnvAgency #whataboutourchalkstreams https://t.co/VSi4dosw7m

Looking at the replies to this it appears the truth is now out there.

The @EnvAgency are a ‚ÄúFailed and discredited organisation‚Äù. https://t.co/B2JJlcQ0hj

As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX

Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

The government must intervene - water companies are not being held to account for their unique role and have been allowed to pollute with impunity by @EnvAgency. @MPGeorgeEustice @pow_rebecca must take the responsibility the @EnvAgency has foregone https://t.co/Xn0o4O705d

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice If I was as utterly useless at my job I'd have been got shot of years ago. @MPGeorgeEustice how about you hold our water companies to account? How about THEY get heavily penalised EVERY time they FLY TIP sewage into our rivers due to their utter incompetenceü§¨

@antony_hig @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 @DefraGovUK Interesting. I seem to remember this funding was secured by the Burnley Labour group and voted against by Burnley Tories. Which seems to fly in the face of your claim that Labour somehow let the people of Burnley down.

Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE
@EnvAgencySW @EnvAgency Shouldn‚Äôt the grills be checked on a regular basis , not just when heavy rain is predicted ?

Hope @EnvAgency develop backbone & protect environment. Their determination on changes to water abstraction permits needed due to pollution risk from @HS2ltd work pushed back to Jan 2021 ‚ÄúDue to a number of complex issues‚Äù 1st sign of a vertebra or an attempt to bury the problem.

Ok
1. Pass Environment Bill ASAP & establish legally binding targets
2. Establish Office of Environmental Responsibility to hold Govt to account
3. Ensure new land management  subsidies support farmers deliver for wildlife 
4. Bolster @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency to enforce law https://t.co/hNvO3w0TM7

Boat lifting and inspections will stop tomorrow because of high winds. The crane will remain on site and work will restart on Wednesday. https://t.co/h1semw1lNY

High winds and heavy rain could cause surface water and river flooding over the weekend. Do not try to drive through floodwater. Be prepared. For the latest updates see
https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4, or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188.

tweets.text: Our field teams are working hard checking flood defences and clearing screens in preparation for heavy rain and high winds this weekend that could cause localised flooding. Be prepared. Check https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4 or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 for the latest flood updates.

It was great to meet Andy and Keith from the @EnvAgencyNW in Padiham earlier today to talk about the much needed flood defences. 
Lots of work is going on now to prepare everything, ready for main work to start next year. And completion is on track for November 2022! https://t.co/Mpy7PNZelX
